name: Aristaeus
body:
### GROUP OBJECTIVES.
The target of this group is to provide the European authorities with the information and roadmaps to set up a complete set of R&D projects that lead to a first fractionated satellite demonstration flight not Later than year 2022. In order to achieve this target, this group proposes to setup a work plan that
includes various documents and milestones presented in this section.

As in previous developments, this group intends to follow a well known approach starting with low TRL activities co-funded by the different administration, advancing then to higher TRL developments led firstly by EC and then by ESA and other actors, ending in a first demonstration flight funded at European level and supervised by ESA from the technical point of view. This means that the group activities should evolve very quickly in the official setup of a European workgroup recognized as a legitimate agent at EC and ESA level. This group will propose some KETs that should be covered by EC projects included in the first half of the H2020 program. 
Then in the second half of the H2020 program, a SRA should be defined covering the most promising technologies developed in the first stage. This SRA should lead then to the kick off of a demonstration mission that would then follow the typical planning of a technology demonstration mission starting by a Phase A where the target application and the detailed feasibility studies should be accomplished with ESA support.

### MEMBERS
The ARISTAEUS Group is fostered by Thales Alenia Space España from the industrial side and by Universidad Politécnica de Catalunya on the Academic area. The target of this group is to include all the actors in present FS studies as well as those space actors that will be involved in the first stages of in orbit demonstration and actual business exploitation of this new technology. Although clearly focused on the European space ecosystem, the group is also open both to actors outside Europe and outside to the present space business environment, being the main selection criteria those related to technical relevance and exploitation capability of the partners. Present partners include:
* Delft University of Technology
* University of Surrey
* EADS-CASA
* GMV
* INTA


### WHAT IS A FRACTIONATED SATELLITE?
The concept of fractionated satellite was devised by DARPA with the following target: “to develop and demonstrate the basic building blocks of a radically new space architecture in which traditional large, multi-functional “monolithic” spacecraft are replaced by clusters of wirelessly interconnected spacecraft elements. Each of these elements performs a subset of the tasks performed by a large classical spacecraft and works together in a cluster to provide the same overall effective mission
capability. Traditionally, taking as example the telecommunications market, space assets are developed as monolithic and large spacecraft. Each of these spacecraft unites all functionalities required to perform its mission. As a consequence, risk of launch failures and in-orbit operations failures would
have a high impact on the availability of service. Moreover, due to its monolithic nature, technologies applied can be mature but outdated, causing a lack of flexibility and eventually an inefficient implementation of a system to satisfy the customer needs. Fractionated satellite technologies, on the contrary, by allowing the various functions of a spacecraft to be developed and launched separately, provide benefits such as reduced overall risk, budgetary and planning flexibility, faster initial deployment, and ultimately greater survivability, including selective replacement of damaged or
obsolete elements of a complex spacecraft”.

![Fractionated Spacecraft ](http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/d/d6/FractionatedSpacecraft1.jpg)

### FRACTIONATED SATELLITE APPLICATIONS
Fractionated and networked architectures can be an answer to recurring problems that weaken the space sector, including significant cost increases linked to the ever increasing size of platforms and associated launch costs, late deliveries, launch mishaps and on-orbit failures. The final target of fractionated satellites is to provide the space stakeholders with a complete new set of capabilities that allow them to target new business and markets or to develop the present ones in a completely new and more competitive way. This will allow the increase of the present market size and the incorporation of new actors in this market with the corresponding wealth and employment generation in a high revenue, strategic, highly technological sector as the space. Among other applications, the following ones are targeted:

* Mixed Functionality Swarms
* Space Service Areas
* In-Orbit Assembly
* Fractionated Telecommunication Satellite
* Fractionated Earth Imaging Satellite
* Fractionated Scientific Satellite
* SSA Applications
* Security Applications

### APPLIED TECHNOLOGIES
ARISTAEUS workgroup is preparing a technological roadmap that intends to cover all the key technologies that will enable the future development of Fractionated satellite systems. The group intends to incorporate experts and future suppliers of these new target technologies:
* FRACTIONATED SATELLITE MISSIONS AND OPERATION
* New Applications Based On Distributed Space Platforms
* Fractionated Satellite Architectures.
* Fractionated Satellite Open Platform Standards.
* Operation And TT&C Techniques For Swarm Management.

* BASIC FRACTIONATED  SATELLITE TECHNIQUES
* Data Transfer Systems For Satellite Swarms.
* High Precision Formation Flying And Cluster
* Flying, Swarm Formation Flying / Cluster Flying.
* Energy Transfer Systems For Satellite Swarms.
* High Precision, Clean Thrusting Techniques.
* Distributed Data Processing On Space Platforms
